intro: Syngonanthus suberosus, commonly known as the roughleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its woody, shrub-like stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Syngonanthus suberosus is adapted to survive in low-water conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
